title: Cramér–Wold theorem
summary: In mathematics, the Cramér–Wold theorem in measure theory states that a Borel probability measure on R k {\displaystyle \mathbb {R} ^{k}} is uniquely determined by the totality of its one-dimensional projections. It is used as a method for proving joint convergence results. The theorem is named after Harald Cramér and Herman Ole Andreas Wold.
